result.execSummary:
The defendant Rodney Lewis Barber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 11/20/2015 @ 1:30pm
PROBATION REVIEW hearing 1/15/2016 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 36.

miscConds.notes:
Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges including the DNA surcharge; civil judgment if not paid.
- Court set restitution at zero.
- No contact with firearms. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

- Complete Batterer's Intervnetion program.
- Attend parenting classes.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No Contact with victim unless approved by the court. The defendant may have contact 3rd party contact to visit with his children.
- Pay supervision fees.
**1/15/2016  Victim in Court requesting modification to the No Contact Order.  Court will leave the decision up to the agent.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED pending review
*11/20/15  STAY LIFTED as to four (4) days.  Order for Commtitment signed/filed.
*1/15/2016 Balance stayed for use at agent's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rodney Lewis Barber

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rodney Lewis Barber in court.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.
The victim is in court and requesting modification of the no contact order.  Court will leave the decision up to the agent.

Defendant Rodney Lewis Barber in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Victim Keondra S. is requesting a modification to the no contact order.  Court denied that request.
  DOC agent also in court.
The Court finds that the defendant has not been complying with the conditions of probation.  The Court ordered the defendant to serve 4 DAYS of the condition time that was stayed to today's date; the stay on the balance of the time is to continue to the next court date.  Defendant taken into custody.  Filed, signed Order For Commitment Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions.
Case adjourned to 01/15/16 at 1:30 p.m. for probation review hearing in Branch 36.

Defendant Rodney Lewis Barber in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Judge Kremers agreed to take this case for Judge Dallet's Court.
Defendant wants to change his plea.
.
As to count 2:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
As to count 1:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered count 1 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
.
Sentencing continued...
.
As to count 2:
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Additional statement by:  Kiaja S.  
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 60 days served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months with the following conditions:
- Serve 60 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Attend parenting classes.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.  The defendant may have 3rd party contact to visit with his children.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges; civil judgment if not paid.
- Pay supervision fees.
 - Pay DNA
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Jury trial date of 08/31/2015 vacated.
The next court date is in Branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Rodney Lewis Barber not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  OFF THE RECORD.

CASE HEARD BY BRANCH 6 FOR BRANCH 40.

Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 40.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Statements made by Keondra S.  Court modified the no contact order to allow 3rd party contact for the purpose of child visitation.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Keondre S or her residence; Latoya J and her residence.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Rodney Lewis Barber in court with attorney Kathryn A Holtz.  Defendant Rodney Lewis Barber in custody.  
Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Motion to dismiss by defense  DENIED by the Court.Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  

DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
